required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Extra Virgin Olive Oil Addition in the Diet of Women With Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (OLIDIAG)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Extra Virgin Olive Oil Addition in the Diet of Women With Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (OLIDIAG)

lead_sponsor.agency: Center for Pharmacological and Botanical Research

clinical_study.source: Center for Pharmacological and Botanical Research

brief_summary.textblock: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is associated to adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes. The aim of this study is to address whether the addition of extra virgin olive oil to the diet of women with GDM improves maternal triglyceridemia and reduces insulin requirement and diagnosis of diabetes at postnatal reclassification.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized trial in which 1200 pregnant women at GDM diagnosis from 16 health care centers will be recruited and randomized in two parallel arms: 1 World Health Organization (WHO)-diet supplemented with 3 tablespoons of Extra Virgin Olive Oil (Intervention Group, n=600); 2. WHO-diet with no Extra Virgin Olive Oil supplementation (Control Group, n=600). Expected results: the investigators expect that the intervention will contribute to improve maternal lipid profile, reduce insulin requirement and reduce maternal diagnosis of diabetes at postpartum reclassification. Thus, this study is expected to identify maternal beneficial effects of this dietary intervention.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dietary intervention study: GDM patients receiving a WHO diet with or without addition of extra virgin olive oil

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from prepregnancy weight to term pregnancy weight
primary_outcome.description: gestational maternal weight gain in kg

primary_outcome.measure: number of participants with insulin requirement

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with diabetes at postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: maternal diagnosis of diabetes at postpartum

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dietary addition of extra virgin olive oil
arm_group.description: WHO diet with a daily addition of extra virgin olive oil

arm_group.arm_group_label: No addition of extra virgin Olive Oil

intervention.description: Daily dietary addition of olive oil (three tablespoons)
intervention.arm_group_label: Dietary addition of extra virgin olive oil

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- GDM (diagnosis criteria of the Latin American Society of Diabetes (ALAD) and Argentine Society of Diabetes (SAD): Fasting plasma glucosa > 100 mg/dl, p75 oral glucose tolerance test-2 h plasma glucose > 140 mg/dl)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancy
- Pregestational diabetes (type 1 or type 2)
- Bariatric surgery
- Infectious diseases
